data.title: Hobgoblins 2 (2009)
data.meta_description: The sequel to the Rick Sloane classic from the 1980's, "Hobgoblins."
data.text:
Hobgoblins, Hobgoblins, Hobgoblins!

Kevin and his friends are back, and with a trip to the local mental institution, so will their old "acquaintances" from the past!

After 14 years it's release (and plenty of years of being a fan of the first movie from it's showing on MST3K), I'm finally getting around to watching the sequel to the 1980's Horror Comedy Hobgoblins!

Hobgoblins Part 2 has enough going for it that many fans of the original will have little trouble getting through the 90 minute runtime here.

It has a nice sense of humor (it's just as much comedy as it is horror), and it has more than enough B-Movie corniness to satisfy most fans of MST3K type movies.

The…

Rec by Child of Chaos Jamie

letterboxd.com/forgotten78/

Aid me in my slow decent into irrevocable madness here

boxd.it/cmQoM

I don't know if it's my steady diet of Burger King dumpster diving or what, but honestly this wasn't to bad.

I actually kind of liked this. I haven't seen Hobgoblins 1 and I get the feeling this is a sequel in name only, because I was not lost for a second. These gremlins show up and feed on people's fear.

I think the middle could have been cut some, and the ending given a little more shoulder room, but I found this to be an enjoyable B movie.

Also, poor Nurse Boobs didn't get to have boring MC's whoopie stick vulcanized…

Those zany Hobgoblins are back! Its Hobgoblins 2: How the Dang Heck Did We get a Sequel Why Does Anyone Need to see our Cheap Floppy puppet Bodies Again?? Answer...I do! I need to see those floppy puppety bodies!

I watched this for two reasons...the first: to see just how absurd and mind boggling a sequel to the low tier puppetploitation trashterpiece Hobgoblins could actually be. THAT TAKES PLACE 21 YEARS AFTER THE FIRST MOVIE And two: I needed to see if they actually fly their dang spaceship as promised on the cover of the first film but completely fraud its viewers by showing no such thing!

So basically you say Hobgoblins three times and they appear...a bunch of goofy…

Hobgoblin 2 (2009) is a movie I recently watched on Tubi. The storyline follows McCreedy from the first film locked up in an asylumn for his hobgoblins claim from 10 years ago. When another outbreak occurs that resemble his stories authorities may need his help to stop the hobgoblins.

This movie is directed by Rick Sloane (Blood Theatre) and stars Josh Mills (Death House), Chanel Ryan (BASEketball), Dan Glenn (Castle), Matthew Mahaney (Eraser) and Karen Knotts (Vice Academy 5).

This is a movie that doesn't take itself seriously in any way. This is more a comedy than horror. The comedic content is even more miss than hit than the first one. I will say the nurse in this is an…
